Welcome to sphinx_lab2’s documentation!¶

Contents:

class main.AceCard(suit)¶

Bases: main.PlayingCard

Class representing the ace card in a deck which inherits from the PlayingCard class.

class main.Hand¶

Bases: object

The Hand class represents a hand of a player which contains cards. Cards can be added and removed from the hand as well as sort the cards in the hand. It can also evaluate which combination of cards gives the best pokerhand.

add_card(card)¶
Parameters:card – An object of type PlayingCard
Returns:Nothing, it adds a card to the players Hand object
best_poker_hand(table_cards)¶

This method evaluates which cards in Hand makes best possible combination of cards.

Parameters:table_cards – A list of cards represented on the table
Returns:A PokerHand which is fully comparable with other PokerHand’s with the normal comparable operators.
best_poker_hand_total(table_cards)¶

A simple method which collects all cards for a player, which includes the cards represented on the table in certain games.

Parameters:table_cards – Cards in a list representing tha cards on the table.
Returns:a list of all possible cards for a player.
remove_card(index)¶
Parameters:index – a list of indices of which cards should be thrown away
Returns:Removes one or multiple cards from Hand if possible
sort_hand()¶

Sorts the hand by suit and then by value.

Returns:Sorted cards in Hand.
class main.JackCard(suit)¶

Bases: main.PlayingCard

Class representing the jack card in a deck which inherits from the PlayingCard class.

class main.KingCard(suit)¶

Bases: main.PlayingCard

Class representing the king card in a deck which inherits from the PlayingCard class.

class main.NumberedCard(value, suit)¶

Bases: main.PlayingCard

Class representing the numbered card in a deck which inherits from the PlayingCard class.

class main.PlayingCard(suit)¶

Bases: object

This class represents a standard class for all individual cards in a deck.

get_name()¶
Returns:The name of the card, for instance “Jack” or “1” etc.
get_suit()¶
Returns:The suit of the card, either spade, diamond, clubs or hearts.
get_value()¶
Returns:The value of the card, ranging from 2 to 14.
class main.PokerHand(hand_rank, rank_value)¶

Bases: object

Uses PokerHandType to create an PokerHand object. Overrides some comparable operators for easier comparisons.

class main.PokerHandType¶

Bases: enum.IntEnum

A PokerHandType class which specifies which kind of PokerHand is worth the most.

class main.QueenCard(suit)¶

Bases: main.PlayingCard

Class representing the queen card in a deck which inherits from the PlayingCard class.

class main.StandardDeck¶

Bases: object

StandardDeck is a class which describes a deck which contains 52 individual cards.

shuffle()¶

This method shuffles the deck.

Returns:Shuffles the deck.
take_top()¶

This method takes the top card and removes it from the deck.

Returns:the top_card of type PlayingCard
class main.Suits¶

Bases: enum.IntEnum

This class defines the values of the suits using enums.

main.create_bins_for_cards(cards)¶

A method that creates bins for a Hand which is then used in best_poker_hand.

Parameters:cards – All cards available for a player.
Returns:Returns some lists of values and suits.
main.flush_test(cards, suit_cards, list)¶

A method to evaluate if the player has a flush.

Parameters:
  • cards – The cards available for the player to evaluate.
  • suit_cards – A list of the suits the player has.
  • list – A list which specifies which cards are in the Hand.
Returns:

Returns True and a PokerHand object if the player has a flush, otherwise False and None.
main.four_of_a_kind_test(list, value_cards)¶

A method to evaluate if the player has four of a kind.

Parameters:
  • list – A list which specifies which cards are in the Hand.
  • value_cards – The values of the cards in Hand.
Returns:

Returns True and a PokerHand object if the player has four of a kind, otherwise False and None.
main.full_house_test(list)¶

A method to evaluate if the player has a full house.

Parameters:list – A list which specifies which cards are in the Hand.
Returns:Returns True and a PokerHand object if the player has a full house, otherwise False and None.
main.high_card_test(list)¶

A method to evaluate what the highest card in players Hand is.

Parameters:list – A list which specifies which cards are in the Hand.
Returns:Returns True and a PokerHand object with the highest cards in the players Hand.
main.one_pair_test(list)¶

A method to evaluate if the player has a pair.

Parameters:list – A list which specifies which cards are in the Hand.
Returns:Returns True and a PokerHand object if the player has a pair, otherwise False and None.
main.straight_flush_test(cards, suit_cards, list, value_cards)¶

A method to evaluate if the player has a straight flush.

Parameters:
  • cards – The cards available for the player to evaluate.
  • suit_cards – A list of the suits the player has.
  • list – A list which specifies which cards are in the Hand.
  • value_cards – The values of the cards in Hand.
Returns:

Returns True and a PokerHand object if the player has a straight flush, otherwise False and None.
main.straight_test(list, value_cards)¶

A method to evaluate if the player has a straight.

Parameters:
  • list – A list which specifies which cards are in the Hand.
  • value_cards – The values of the cards in Hand.
Returns:

Returns True and a PokerHand object if the player has a straight, otherwise False and None.
main.three_of_a_kind_test(list, value_cards)¶

A method to evaluate if the player has a three of a kind.

Parameters:
  • list – A list which specifies which cards are in the Hand.
  • value_cards – The values of the cards in Hand.
Returns:

Returns True and a PokerHand object if the player has a three of a kind, otherwise False and None.
main.two_pairs_test(list, value_cards)¶

A method to evaluate if the player has two pairs.

Parameters:
  • list – A list which specifies which cards are in the Hand.
  • value_cards – The values of the cards in Hand.
Returns:

Returns True and a PokerHand object if the player has two pairs, otherwise False and None.
